login-select-method.title: MyYivi login
login-select-method.intro-par1: This is the MyYivi environment of the Privacy by Design Foundation. Using this website you can view the activities of your Yivi app, and block your Yivi app.
login-select-method.intro-par2: The foundation knows when your Yivi app is used, but does not know where or with what information. In this way a combination of security and privacy is pursued. The MyYivi usage log allows you to check if your Yivi app is being abused. If so, you can block your Yivi app here.
login-select-method.login-methods: Below you can log in to MyYivi in two ways:
login-select-method.login-method-yivi: Using your Yivi app, by scanning a QR code; this is the easiest way.
login-select-method.login-method-email: Using the e-mail address you registered with. If you enter this below, you will be sent a link that will take you to MyYivi. You can use this option if you don't have your phone at hand, or worse, if your phone has been stolen and you want to rule out abuse of your Yivi app
login-select-method.check-email-text: Log in by clicking on the link sent to your e-mail address.

login-select-candidate.title: Choose Yivi app ID
login-select-candidate.explanation: The email address you use to log in is linked to several Yivi apps, which are shown in the table below. The meaning of the columns is as follows:
login-select-candidate.candidates-item-1: your Yivi app ID. This is located in your Yivi app under "More" (at the bottom of the screen).
login-select-candidate.candidates-item-2: when data was last received or released with this Yivi app.

login-email-sent.title: Check your e-mail
login-email-sent.explanation: Log in by clicking on the link sent to your e-mail address. If you have not received anything, then the e-mail address you entered is probably not known to us.

registration-verified.title: MyYivi registration finished
registration-verified.explanation: Your e-mail address has been linked to your Yivi app successfully.
registration-verified.app-is-ready: Your Yivi app is now ready for use.

logs.header: View usage of your Yivi app

logs-events.PIN_CHECK_BLOCKED: PIN wrong too often, blocked {{param}} seconds

emails.explanation: The following e-mail addresses are associated to your Yivi app. You can login on MyYivi using each of these addresses. If you have already <0>loaded your e-mail address in your Yivi app</0> you can associate it to your Yivi app using the button below.
emails.no-email-addresses: There are no e-mail addresses associated to your Yivi app. This means that you will not be able to log in on MyYivi and block the data in your Yivi app, in case you lose your phone.
emails.delete-confirm-explanation: Are you sure you want to delete {{email}}?

delete-account.explanation-par1: If you delete your MyYivi, all the data in your Yivi app becomes permanently unusable, and all events as well as your e-mail address will be permanently deleted.
delete-account.explanation-par2: <0>Warning:</0> Blocking or deleting your MyYivi is permanent! If you want to use IRMA again afterwards you will have to re-install the Yivi app and re-obtain all your data.
delete-account.alert-explanation: If you proceed, all the data in your Yivi app will become permanently unusable, and your logs and e-mail address will be deleted from MyYivi. Are you sure?

load-cards.explanation: Go to <0>this page</0> to load more data in your Yivi app, or refresh existing data.

token-invalid.explanation-details: You can still add your e-mail address so that you can block your Yivi app in case of loss or theft:
token-invalid.point-2: Click on 'Open Yivi app' or scan the QR code with your Yivi app.
token-invalid.point-3: Follow the instructions in your Yivi app to log in to MyYivi.
token-invalid.point-4: Click on 'Add e-mail address' and follow the instructions to add your e-mail address to MyYivi.

error-message.explanation: The requested action could not be processed. Please check your internet connection and try again. If the problem keeps occurring, please contact Yivi.
